issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Android: Accessibility: SearchBar: Setting 'accessibilityHidden: true' disables searchbar to gain focus by clicking over it.
fields.environment:
Environment used for verification -
Titanium SDK:3.0.0.v20121120110430
Titanium Â Studio:3.0.0.201211131839
Device : Nexus 7(4.1)
Xcode : 4.5 
Machine OS : MAC 10.8

comments.body:
So far I've been unable to reproduce this.
Clicking on the 4th search bar causes it to gain focus.

My environments:

Nexus 7, Android 4.2
SDK 3_0_X
Titanium Studio 2.1.0

Samsung Galaxy SIII (Sprint), Android 4.1.1
SDK 3_0_X
Titanium Studio 2.1.0

If you can still reproduce this, can you show me?  Thanks.
Hey Karl, what version of sdk and studio did you use?
Must turn on accessibility to see the failure, I can still reproduce this issue with 3.0.0.v20121127163410 on Nexus 10 4.2

Not a bug. Only 4.1 android and above supports the hidden property and in this case the hidden property is working as expected. When that property is set to true, that object does not exist when accessibility is turned on, but when accessibility is turned off then the user can access the object.
